website_summaries.verdict: Superior cleaning experience delivered by industry leader in dental hygiene. Powerful to effectively clean build-up, yet gentle enough for braces wearers, especially after recent adjustments.
pros: Intuitive modes include pressure sensor if brushing is too hard, and built-in timer that lets you know when to brush different area of the mouth
Compatible with more than one brush head style
cons: Charging time is unusually long, and depleted battery causes rotation to work intermittently
Some crevices in product design could let bacteria and dirt accumulate

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE
customer_reviews.text: This was the first product I purchased from Amazon that became defective shortly after the return date had passed. The toothbrush recharged properly for about a month, then quit. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Melnee R Kasper

customer_reviews.title: Got a Oral-B White Pro 1000 Box, with a Pro 3000 brush.
customer_reviews.text: Correct box, wrong product. You'd think, score upgrade right? Wrong. I can't even use the toothbrush without having to download an app and connect it to my phone. It has 3 brushing modes all of which are way too powerful, that you have to cycle through to the thing off. Why would anyone want to connect their toothbrush to their phone?
customer_reviews.author: Hod

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: After a number of years my old one finally died. I chose to save money and buy this one without all the features of my old one. This one has one speed, fine I only used one speed on the old one. This one has the quadrant timer like my old one, love that. This one has a steel stem to hold the brush, my old one was stainless steel, here the cost/effort ratio, you need to wipe the stem and separate the head from the handle each time to keep stem from rusting. No problem for me but others may find that a pain.
customer_reviews.author: LAM/ DLA

customer_reviews.title: Loud and tough on the teeth
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. I swear this toothbrush is going to vibrate outta my hand! It’s way to strong and wicked loud. I’m not a fan of the revolving brush and it’s way too hard. My daughter seems to like hers, but I stopped using it after a week. Maybe I’m old, but I like Quiet 🙉
customer_reviews.author: msprout

customer_reviews.title: Shreds my gums
customer_reviews.text: I hate this. My whole mouth is sore and by day three I was spitting blood. And the vibration, especially when it's giving you the 30-second warning, feels like a jackhammer on my skull. Maybe a softer head would help but they brushes cost more than the entire unit.
customer_reviews.author: Sandal

customer_reviews.title: Oral-B + Braun = Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: My dentist - while cleaning my teeth last week - kept drilling me, "YOU HAVE TO GET AN ELECTRIC TOOTH BRUSH TO FIGHT OFF YOUR PLAQUE BUILD-UP YOU ALWAYS GET!" So, I decided to follow her advice. I saw the ratings on this and was very skeptical because of the bargain price. This is the best toothbrush I have ever used! It gets the job done, it notifies you via vibration when you've completed 2 minutes of brushing, and it's very sensitive on the teeth. I've never had cleaner teeth every morning and night like this. Must buy and try!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Painful, Swollen Gums
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this toothbrush. It is so rough, and the bristles on the head that it came with are very coarse. Not for people with sensitive teeth and gums!
customer_reviews.author: NOYB

customer_reviews.title: It felt like a jackhammer in my mouth and causes toothaches
customer_reviews.text: This product is too powerful to use. It felt like a jackhammer in my mouth and causes toothaches.
customer_reviews.author: Trudy-Ann

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful at first
customer_reviews.text: Update: Amazon told me to contact the Braun Co, which I did. They told me to send the toothbrush back and they would repair of replace it!! I will update this again when I hear more from them. I ordered this toothbrush for my husband for Christmas. He was thrilled and it worked beautifully for 2 months...then it quit. :( He is so very careful with everything and followed the directions explicitly. I don't know if we got a lemon or if these toothbrushes just don't last very long. (I bought about a year's supply of extra brushes in anticipation of this being the most wonderful toothbrush.)
customer_reviews.author: jamfromOK

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toothbrush to replace my 3D excel, which seemed to be losing power after only one year. What a difference! The Oral-B Pro 1000 has a lot more power and my teeth feel so much cleaner when I'm done. However, this one died after just over a year as well. Because the excel didn't last long, I bought an asurion protection plan for this one. When I filed the claim, however, I was told to contact Oral B, as the problem may be covered under the original warranty! Oral-B requires you to pay shipping costs to return the product. I expect asurion does, too. What a rip-off.
customer_reviews.author: L. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Rough on teeth and gums😨😨😨
customer_reviews.text: The electric toothbrush is noisy and rough on teeth and gums. Added to that, the brush is stiff. If you have sensitive gums, crowns or bridges,this toothbrush is so strong I worry about the damage it could cause. I should have returned it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: K. King

customer_reviews.title: Vibrates so strong is not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I just received this toothbrush and have used it for about 4 days. My initial response is it’s awful. I have had a sonicare for years and in comparison I am very disappointed. The OralB is loud but the main complaint I have is the vibration. Like I said, I’ve used electric toothbrushes for years and loved them. The OralB vibrates so hard when you look in the mirror my whole face is vibrating so much you can’t even see straight. It’s ridiculous for the cost. I will give it a few more weeks as other buyers seemed to warm up to the product. But at this point I am very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Sizemore

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but should come with a brush holder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as our 2nd one to be used when we travel, as the one we already own has a large base with holders and is not compact for traveling. It performs just fine cleaning our teeth. But (isn't there always a but) I wanted a toothbrush holder, since this one does not come with any. I growled because no holder was shown below the toothbrush (growl). I did find one, but it took more search time than I thought necessary. For a brush holder, anyone interested search for "single charger holder toothbrush heads" and Oral-B 3757. Note that it costs $10.
customer_reviews.author: Aircarl

customer_reviews.title: Battery failed after 2 months of use despite following manufacturer care instructions.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked how well this toothbrush worked for cleaning teeth but I have to rate it 1 star due to the horrible reliability/durability. The battery failed after 1 month despite following manufacturer care instructions. I charged the toothbrush on the charging stand every night and the LED indicator showed the status as charging. However, every time I use the toothbrush, the motor slowly dies down then it stops completely after ~30 seconds of use. Occasionally it will start back up then die again after another 30-45 seconds. I really liked this toothbrush and I'm sure I just got unlucky and got a dud, but the lack of reliability has made me seriously reconsider ever buying an Oral-B product again.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K Skursha

customer_reviews.title: Very harsh on your gums
customer_reviews.text: My dentist recommended an electric toothbrush to me to be gentler on my gums. This thing is like a buzzsaw on your gums. With only one brushing mode, it's terrible for me. And while the main surfaces of my teeth felt smoother with this, it did not do a good job cleaning between the teeth. I'm sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: CVB

customer_reviews.title: The battery does not hold a charge.
customer_reviews.text: I really hated to provide a bad review. However, the product just could not hold a charge. I definitely love the tooth brush with the pulse that reminds you to switch quadrants. Again, the battery just could not hold a charge. So in much love I was with it, I ordered another one for myself and my husband. Again, we charged it for as long as the light would blink only to realize after 24 hours plus that it still did not work. If there is a better product. Please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Franklin

customer_reviews.title: An enormous step forward
customer_reviews.text: After brushing with a standard toothbrush my entire life, switching to this electric one has been a huge game changer. I've always had good oral hygiene, but this toothbrush has helped me step it up even more. The oscillating movement is what my dentist recommends for a good, even cleaning that does not damage the tooth enamel, better mirroring the movement of the dentist's own tools. And the timer helps me know I am spending a sufficient amount of time brushing each quadrant of my mouth. I won't go back to a standard toothbrush again, and I highly recommend this product to anyone else who is serious about their oral health.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Herron

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: My first electric toothbrush. It’s ok. Pros - dentist recommends an electric brush and this one isn’t too expensive - 30sec timer - toothbrush doesn’t turn off automatically after 2min (this is good bc I haven’t gotten my timing/pace down yet - easy to clean Cons - I thought I’d be indifferent about the charger, but I have an old house with tiny bathrooms. The charger takes up too much space on my single vanity - I don’t notice a difference in sound/vibration when I’m adding too much pressure while brushing This brush does the job but I’ve decided to try out another e-toothbrush
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie S.

customer_reviews.title: Loud but Cleans
customer_reviews.text: I have used Philips for the past several years. I read/heard multiple comments about Oral B claiming they do a very good job cleaning-yes they do. But it is SO LOUD. I have been using it for a week and still annoys me when I turn it on. I mean seriously my cat gets scared when he hears it. I have to close the bathroom door like when I blow my hair. I wonder if the more expensive versions are better. But hey it gets the job done, I feel my teeth cleaner than when I was using Philips. Otherwise I’d returned it already.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This product worked fine until one day, after the return window had closed, it just stopped working, in the middle of brushing my teeth no less. I plugged in the charger and left the tooth brush in place overnight to recharge, but to no avail. There was no warning or blinking light to tell me the brush needed to be recharged. This toothbrush is poorly designed anyway--it is impossible to dry it off because there are open holes which catch the water. As a result there is always a puddle of water and toothpaste on the sink.
customer_reviews.author: NancyCats

customer_reviews.title: Waiting for it to break! :-(
customer_reviews.text: I really don’t like this product. It’s very noisy. Secondly, the saliva slides down the brush while in use. Very gross! I used a another electric truck toothbrush for 15 years before it simply wore out. I stupidly decided to try something different...bad move! But who returns a tooth brush? I’m stuck with but can’t wait for it to break!
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: The best toothbrush I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I think this brush will make it much less necessary to see the dentist. COVID makes such visits something I'd like to put off a while. Good deep cleaning. Gum health has improved a lot since I started using it. Combine this with a good water pic using a little hydrogen peroxide in the water pic's water, and you have a good routine for perfect dental care. Doesn't take much hydrogen peroxide. I suspect a good periodontal mouth wash would work too. Wish I had done this many years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lousy product failed in less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Thought I'd try Oral B after years of Sonic Care and what a mistake. The unit finally died after less than 2 months. Besides sounding like jack hammer when using, the recharge light started to come on more frequently which got my attention. Two days ago I recharged over night to see after one use the red recharge light was on again so I once again plugged it in. This morning it died completely mid-brushing. I see the lousy warranty wants me to send the unit back prepaid or bring it to a service center. I don't think I will waste my time doing that nor ever by an Oral B product again. Think Sonic Care!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product because I desperately need an electric toothbrush that does deep cleaning. I was super excited after reading the positive reviews, but this toothbrush ended up making my gums swollen and the hard pressure from the vibrations created some sort of cut/burn on the side of the inside of my mouth. :( I waited till it was healed to try again (and we all know it takes forever for the inside of your mouth to heal), but the same thing happened again. I tried to return to Amazon, but they were extremely unhelpful. I'm just going to toss this now and it's such an expensive waste.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Great Model
customer_reviews.text: My dental hygienist recommended an electric toothbrush, but offered a more expensive model. This model is cheaper and provides the same features. I love it. I wish I had purchased it sooner. It's not too harsh on my gums and my teeth feel very clean after each use. My favorite feature is the 30 second "vibration" that signals when you should move to brush the other areas. The brush also has a light indicator when its on its base to show when its charging. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sun Goddess

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Enough to Knock Out a Filing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after recommendation by my dentist and I loved it for a few days, my teeth felt clean. However, one night I felt something gritting and realized that it was my entire filing that was knocked out by this toothbrush. So I had the filing done again only for the process to repeat itself.....a total fo 3 times after which I decided against using this toothbrush. If you into very powerful toothbrushes, this is the one for you. I'm still on the look out for a gentler toothbrush since I want to keep my finings intact.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Average Spin Brush
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was an average electric toothbrush all around. It worked well, the brush speed was not too hard though it left some tartar. I also did not like how the brush head has a hole in it where water can get in and bacteria can grow and start to smell. Same thing would happen at the brush base where the toothbrush would charge. It would get very dirty at the base, water would pool, gunk would form and harden, making it not easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Angela C.

customer_reviews.title: Cleans so well!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time i have been using this rechargeable Oral B. The first one was a matrimonial gift. It last for 6 years and had to replace it it since the holder is starting to wear off but the battery still works great. I have visit my dentist, and she's actually told me i have a good dental record. Battery last longer, cleanse my teeth really well, gums is healthy. Highly recommend to anyone who are looking for this kind of product.
customer_reviews.author: Ma Roma Espera

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Loud
customer_reviews.text: I really dislike this toothbrush. It is so strong (and loud), it hurts my back teeth when I use it. I've been using the Phillips Sonicare for at least 10 years and loved it, but when it came time for a new one, I thought i would try Oral B since my dentist recommends them. I will continue to use this until the brushes (I ordered extra) are gone and then purchase the Phillips again. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Oral B electric toothbrush has a small 'head'
customer_reviews.text: I was not pleased with the Oral B electric toothbrush because it has such a small 'head.' I compared it with the Sonicare one and the reviews indicated the Oral B was better rated. Well, I know own a Sonicare (my daughter is married to a dentist, so she had an extra one). The Sonicare does a good job and the brush is the right size for me. To be honest, I miss the old fashioned tooth brush! I do love my Water Pik, a device that targets food left between teeth in a most pleasant fashion. Together with the eletric toothbrush and flossing, I am maintaining good oral hygiene.
customer_reviews.author: judy

customer_reviews.title: Not as Good as My Old Sonicare
customer_reviews.text: Louder than expected. Too much vibration. In the past, I have used Sonicare and this Oral B doesn't seem as good. My dental professional said she prefers Sonicare. She said spin brush heads can push gums back.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a Jackhammer
customer_reviews.text: This brush does a good job at cleaning my teeth but Good Lord, is it LOUD. I found the stock brush to be way too hard so I purchased the sensitive gum care brush refills, which made a huge difference: I do like the fact that it is rechargeable - just wished it wasn't so obnoxiously loud.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M.

customer_reviews.title: I’m a dentist
customer_reviews.text: Do Not buy this pos. You’ll find a better toothbrush at Walgreens for $10.00. It rattles your entire head when you try to brush. It’s CHEAPLY MADE. I mean cheap. I’m returning mine! AVOID unless you enjoy migraine headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Perk322

customer_reviews.title: Received a used toothbrush (!)
customer_reviews.text: Clearly a used device. Scuffs and stains on the handle, and the battery seems weirdly weak and low powered even after a day of charging. They did provide a clean new head though for my pre-owned toothbrush. :/
customer_reviews.author: D. Bier

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: This is ok but I Regular tooth brush is better for deep cleaning. I use dental floss after brushing my teeth, and more things come out after using an electric toothbrush than a regular toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: RFJ

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 2.5 years
customer_reviews.text: I love this toothbrush and it cleans superbly especially for the price. Only complaint is it just died all of a sudden. It just won't turn on and I know it's not the charger because my friend has the same brush and tried using my charger with no problems. I'll buy another one to give it another chance but if it dies suddenly, I'll try another expensive option after this.
customer_reviews.author: Successishere

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace another electric toothbrush that I had for a long time. It works great, seems to fit my hand better than my previous one, and is easy to use. Head replacement is simple and the change in vibration every 30 seconds to indicate time to change location in your mouth of cleaning is a nice touch. It's not a big deal but I wish it lasted longer on a charge. It lasts about 4 to 5 days on a charge which is about the same as my old toothbrush. I was hoping it might last longer.
customer_reviews.author: roger s

customer_reviews.title: NO!! Just say NO! I call BS!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: ZERO STARS Purchased Feb 2020 by April it was RATTLY, very noise and smelled like sewage. Battery acid was leaking, as spots but I kind of kept putting it to the back of my mind. I am a busy person. I finally called ORAL B. They said it was all my fault, I wasn't cleaning my toothbrush and this was only toothpaste. BS!!! I know the difference between battery acid and toothpaste. They told me to take pix and send, then they will judge. I told them BS!!! They already decided that the issue was mine. They do not stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Val Turquoise

customer_reviews.title: Won't charge after ONE week
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for the first week after I got it. Then, when I went to charge it, the brush wouldn't charge. The green blinker is on and indicates that the brush is seemingly charging. However, after 3 days of sitting on the charging dock, the brush is still showing the green blinker and won't turn on. Really upset because when it worked, it worked pretty well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superior cleaning and great features
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my husband. My husband had an electric toothbrush which did not have all the features this one does. He has mentioned several times how much he likes it and how very well it cleans his teeth. In his words it is waaayy better than what he had before and he thought that one was good. He loves the features this one has but also keeps saying he can't get over the superior cleaning he gets from it. Nor knowing much about them, I had read reviews on several electric toothbrushes before I decided to get him this one. Very glad it all worked out so well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, but charging base needs better design.
customer_reviews.text: Cleans well. Biggest complaint is the charging base. It’s concaved, so it catches water and you have to keep cleaning it often. Otherwise it will get really gross. Advice for designers, give it a draining channel or make it flat.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Rivals a sonic toothbrush!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toothbrush because of the many good reviews on multiple sites. I love how clean my teeth feel when I use this toothbrush. I have had rotary electric toothbrushes before and always preferred a sonic brush (Sonicare, Waterpik). When my Waterpik brush died, I decided to try this Oral-B Pro 1000 brush. It works just as well as the sonic brushes! When I went for my dental appointment, my hygienist didn't notice a difference in terms of gum health, plaque build-up, etc.
customer_reviews.author: D Hall

customer_reviews.title: Miles ahead of Sonicare - Great for sensitive teeth/gums
customer_reviews.text: I've had Sonicare toothbrushes since college and used them religiously. But my second one was wearing out and I was sick of the clunky size and decided to poke around for a new electric brush. It only took one brushing to tell this Oral B model is MILES ahead of Sonicare. I have a small mouth so the smaller toothbrush head is much better, not to mention it's circular and fits into the hard-to-reach areas between and behind my teeth. ALSO, my gums and teeth are sensitive and this brush doesn't ever leave them feeling tender. I've been using it a few months and it's fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi smucker

customer_reviews.title: i like it
customer_reviews.text: My old Phillips Sonicare died so I decided to give this one a try. It has a lot more power than my sonicare (an older model) so it does make my nose tickle a little but not bad and I think I will get used to it. The higher power feels like a better clean and my teeth do feel much cleaner after brushing than my sonicare. I think they are both good but I am enjoying the Oral B for now. The indicator light is easily visible for too much pressure. Some reviews stated that the power button is in a bad place but I think it is just fine and easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Jp100

customer_reviews.title: Loud but seems effective
customer_reviews.text: Either I haven’t read the instructions thoroughly or the brush I have isn’t the same one I ordered. I’m pretty sure there is no Bluetooth (really?) and no timer. It sounds like a WWII bomber when you hit the power switch . . . You know like in the old B&W movies and I swear one of the engines cuts out every now and then and I think the brush is going to crash. 😆 it seems to be cleaning well but the jury is still out on that one. I’ll know for sure when I go for my next cleaning. Battery life is way less than a week. So if you’re traveling. . . Anywhere, don’t forget the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Judy A. Mcghee

customer_reviews.title: NO Pressure Sensor
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this model of toothbrush for years, it's never died on me but I have hard water and it gets gunky after a couple years. It's a great toothbrush but I'm annoyed that it's advertised as having a pressure sensor.....no it doesn't. I've tested it multiple times by pressing down super hard on purpose and the toothbrush NEVER stops. False advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora

customer_reviews.title: Teeth are finally clean!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toothbrush! I have severe dry mouth that has caused me 1 gum surgery. I started using this toothbrush and my gums have healed faster in 3 months than they have in the past 3 years. It took a few days to get used to the vibration in my head but it doesn't bother me anymore unless I press too hard. Now, if I use a standard toothbrush I don't feel like my teeth are clean. I have only used the main brush head and it is holding up well with me brushing my teeth 2 or 3 times a day. I wish the charge would last longer than 2 - 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Willow

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband and I after our dentist recommended that an electric toothbrush was the way to go - and I am SO GLAD that we switched!! I have never had such clean feeling teeth after a brush than I have with these and will NEVER go back to a manual brush. We have sinced switch our sons to them as well - and they are getting positive feedback from their dentist as well. They may not have every "extra" all these other brands and kinds offer - but seriously - why do you need them?? Worth every cent - and recommend highly!
customer_reviews.author: Meredith S.

customer_reviews.title: Work only for 6m
customer_reviews.text: So bad. It worked fine for about 6months. I gave it to my mom and she was super happy. Then 6m later, after she was already at our home country. It stop working. She try to make the warranty work but nobody knows that model back in her country. Ridiculous. If you are a brand like oral b and you offer a world wide warranty, you should be able to offer repair of any models anywhere in your official shops. But beside that, sont buy form this seller. I bougth my oralB at Costco 3 years ago, still working like day number one.
customer_reviews.author: Romina

customer_reviews.title: Receding Gums
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Too much pressure. It is receding gums. After using a couple of times I see frankly it is destroying my gums. I afraid using this product for long time would make a worse result. Pros: Has a timer it is good. Can clean your mouth very well. Don't advice. Don't use. Be careful with your gums. Don't let such of products destroy your teeth. Or buy more sensitive ones but not Oral-B White Pro 1000.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Works great, looks great, and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Clean, elegant (for a toothbrush) and the battery charge lasts for several days at least. Leaves your teeth feeling like you just had a professional cleaning. There are several different brush heads that you can use with this toothbrush, and the one I recommend is the "Cross-Action" head. Mine came with that one, but I tried a couple of the others, and like the Cross-Action the best. Go to the Oral-B website for a description of the different available heads
customer_reviews.author: Alan RC

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of the Oral B Pro Braun and it had a big stand with extra brush holders in a case with a cap. It took up much more space and was a nightmare to clean all the pieces that disassembled. This is a one piece charger that has about a 1 square inch footprint. It has a seamless peg that stabilizes and charges it by simply setting the brush on the small platform. Super easy cleaning. It has all the brushing features of my original to time the four quadrants for a perfect 2 minute session. It also has gentle, normal, and cleaning modes on the same on/off button.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: This is not like the older models -INTENSE
customer_reviews.text: Will not be using this, a waste of $$. Everyone in the house tried it and agree - its too intense and fast. IF I still had the box I"d return it to Braun.
customer_reviews.author: SRP

customer_reviews.title: Nice brush: Automatic grunge build-up included free
customer_reviews.text: This Oral-B toothbrush works well, providing a vigorous yet not brutal cleaning. However, it has one feature I would prefer to do without: automatic grunge build-up. For reasons not apparent to me, the shaft of the detachable brush head has open ports on the front and back (see product photos) that admit liquids and debris from a user's mouth. Avoiding a build-up of biota, possibly including molds and pathogens, requires removing and rinsing the brush head after every use. My predecessor Braun model permitted thorough rinsing of the brush head without this extra step.
customer_reviews.author: Axel Kassel

customer_reviews.title: At first when it was brand new it was very good. My teeth never felt cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for almost a year now. At first when it was brand new it was very good. My teeth never felt cleaner. But about half a year later the battery doesn't hold as much charge anymore. I have to charge it weekly. I find that I brush for longer with this than I would with a manual toothbrush to get the same level of clean as that of a manual brush. I sometimes have to finish brushing with a manual brush since this brush doesnt clean well around the gum line and between teeth, especially the back teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Bennet G.

customer_reviews.title: Too Rough
customer_reviews.text: Don’t like this at all...it is so aggressive that I feel like it’s going to knock out my teeth. Was trying to find something where I could be more targeted in brushing but going back to a manual brush.
customer_reviews.author: westchester_man

customer_reviews.title: Very loud and hard on your teeth
customer_reviews.text: I’m not super thrilled with this electric toothbrush. There are a few negatives: it’s super loud, the pressure sensor is not a sensor at all and the bristles feel rough on my teeth. It definitely does a deep clean and the timer is helpful, but other than that, it’s not great.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren T.

customer_reviews.title: Solid, no-frills brush
customer_reviews.text: I’m coming to this brush from a Philips SoniCare brush in the same price range. I like that the replacement heads for this brush are less expensive with more available selection, but the battery doesn’t hold a charge for nearly as long (the specs say 10 days, which is on the high side), and the brush head feels like a mouthful compared to the more slim SoniCare. They both do a great job cleaning, this model just feels cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: jjbco

customer_reviews.title: Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: For the last ten or so years I've been using a Phillips electric toothbrush. It's been good but finally died so I purchased an Oral-B Electric toothbrush. For the price--considerably less money than the Phillips original-- this toothbrush really does the job. I never used the different brushing speeds and felt they were a joke, really. This one has one speed, sufficient for getting the job done efficiently. This thing has TORQUE! I can feel a buzzing in my head when I use it, it's so powerful. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Faye R.

customer_reviews.title: Great checkups since using oral-B products.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this for two years and continues to work well. I do notice the time between needing recharges has dropped and the recharge indicator light is taking longer to tell me, even though I can tell the brush has slowed considerably. I had an earlier - and much more expensive - Oral-B that seemed to last longer but I can't complain. Eventually the battery is what does these in. I think two years life is fine and I'm still using it, despite needing a recharge about every two weeks now (only brush once a day and only about one full minute). I will buy another Oral B product in the future. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Makes Me Miss My Waterpik
customer_reviews.text: The thing is loud, under powered, and the battery is wonky. I store it on the charger, and occasionally I pull it off completely drained. The disposable electric brushes have more power and are a lot cheaper. Waterpik costs more, but works much better. Though Amazon seems to have lost it's damn mind on pricing these things. The one I got six years ago for about $80 now costs over $300.
customer_reviews.author: MrTripps

customer_reviews.title: Like Commandeering a Small Aircraft in Your Mouth!
customer_reviews.text: When I finally got around to opening this product when my old Oral B sonic toothbrush died, I couldn't believe: (1) how BULKY and awkward the handle was....like a joystick! (2) how unbelievably LOUD it is. It sounds like a small airplane is landing in the bathroom when I use it. (3) what a TERRIBLE job it did. I was expecting the same quality I'd gotten from my past two Oral-B's but this was a huge disappointment. What's even worse, because I waited until I actually needed it, it's too late to return it. I do not recommend this brush at all.
customer_reviews.author: A Partin

customer_reviews.title: It's just not comfortable for me.
customer_reviews.text: My electric toothbrush from a different manufacturer was worn out. Because of the high ratings for the Oral-B Power Pro, I decided to buy one. I gave it a good try, but I hated it. The head of the toothbrush is too large to comfortably move it between my teeth and my cheeks, the vibration is annoying and I don't like the way it cleans my teeth. Also, the timer is odd. It just feels like the motor is skipping a beat. I'm returning it and going back a new version of my last toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Jack

customer_reviews.title: Deep Cleans for Decent Price
customer_reviews.text: Way better than a regular tooth brush, I can never go back now. Gives me a super deep clean. Battery life is decent. Brush heads can get expensive but you change it every 3 months. The timer function is amazing and helps a ton. One major downfall is it seems to hold water somewhere around the brush so when you out it on the charger it pools some gunky water. Easy to clean but haven't found a way around that.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Ostrom

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: This is my first electric toothbrush and I’m OBSESSED. You can tell the difference between this and a regular toothbrush! Your mouth doesn’t even feel clean after going back to a regular tooth brush. The amount of strokes per minute an electric toothbrush is 100x more than what your arm can do! The first few time I used it I didn’t notice much of a difference but when I really made an effort to polish and get around the entire tooth OMG it was unbelievable! The charging port is a little sensitive so make sure it’s on the right way. Overall I have nothing bad to say
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Good clean feeling
customer_reviews.text: This toothbrush has taken me a bit of getting used to after using an electric brush that went back and forth as opposed to this circular motion. But the clean is good and that's what matters. It's a little louder than my last, the timer function pauses slightly to indicate each 30 seconds. The 2nd 30 seconds pauses twice, 3rd three times and so on so that took getting used to also. But after a couple of weeks all is good and I'm enjoying the good clean feeling.
customer_reviews.author: MarkMak

customer_reviews.title: What was suggested for my teeth
customer_reviews.text: My last cleaning the dental hygenist suggested I get an electric toothbrush because of the deep gum pockets I have. I researched and found many liked this one so I ordered. I am very happy with the brush it is helping me get my teeth clean better and the inflamed and hurting gums are much better. I am not needing to take an asprin for the pain in a few days. My teeth are also feeling much cleaner. The vibration feater to change the sectors is very handy since I was not brushing long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Lakenvelder Muse

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to, but noisy
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised but significantly noisier than other similarly priced models. Additionally, I feel like the included brush head is a bit rougher on my gums than other brands and maybe other Oral-B brush heads (haven't tried), but it's not a deal breaker. If you want an entry-level electric toothbrush without all the useless bells and whistles of more expensive models, this one is worth picking up if it's on sale; otherwise, I like a different brand's (rhymes with tulips sorta) entry level model better, which you can usually find on sale for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan K.

customer_reviews.title: too forceful
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing another Oral B that I've used for years and that eventually stopped working. I use an electric toothbrush because I have receding gums and sensitivity. I chose this model because I don't need any extra bells and whistles, and didn't think I needed adjustable speeds - I never changed the speed on the old one, which had 3 speeds. However, the one and only speed on this is so fast and felt so strong, even with minimal pressure from me, that I found it very uncomfortable to use. I will not use this toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: pam spencer

customer_reviews.title: You should try it
customer_reviews.text: This electric toothbrush cleans my teeth very well. It whitens my teeth and can clean through and between my teeth. however it is a little too fast if you ask me. still ,I highly suggest this electric toothbrush to everyone it includes a charger and can remind you when you need to charge it, it can be used for a long time before you need to refill the energy. It is really handy if you bring it out for a vacation or anywhere you go.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Only telling the trooth
customer_reviews.text: This model is as basic as they come it does come with a pressure sensors meaning it will start to stop and go to let you know your pushing too hard on your teeth and gums. A full charge takes about a whole but will last you for about three days without charging but if you constantly house it’s on the charger you’ll be fine. I recommend this toothbrush but if your looking for all the unnecessary additions look for another model
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Good toothbrush with some slight flaws
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but sounds like Charles Lindbergh is bringing his biplane in for a landing. It doesn’t hold a charge as long as I’d like (4-5 days), but to be fair it does recharge very quickly. There are a number of disposable brushes to chooses from. I like the toothbrush, with the reservations mentioned above.
customer_reviews.author: KMann2

customer_reviews.title: cleans teeth like crazy, not for tomatoes
customer_reviews.text: this toothbrush replaced an older unit i had used for years. the amount of vibration and scrubbing that it produces is amazing and the smaller brush head fits into tight spaces well. I can brush a whole week on one charge so i setup the charger only when needed. I always used to use my older electric toothbrush to vibrate my tomato plants for pollination, this new brush is too energetic for that so my older brush has a new permanent place in the garden.
customer_reviews.author: DMann

customer_reviews.title: Overall, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both bought one of these after a dentist recommendation due to brushing too hard. The pressure sensor has definitely solved that. I also love how clean my teeth feel after brushing. It’s like getting a 6month dental cleaning, but instead every time I brush myself! My only complaint is that even after a week of keeping this relatively clean, there was still toothpaste buildup and such between the brush head attachment and the toothbrush itself.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Watch the covered switch for wear!
customer_reviews.text: Fine product, performs nicely (get the biggest head for it, unless you like doing one tooth at a time), and mine lasted about 7 years with daily use. The Achilles heel of this product is its off/on button that is enclosed in rubber. Eventually that rubber cracks with just the pressure of a thumb turning it on or off. Mine cracked just under the button, probably because the rubber flexes more there. Once the crack is there the electronics inside are going to get wet. Then I got a RED flashing light for the first time! Time to replace it, same price here as Walmart.com ($41.97, on 2-23-17)
customer_reviews.author: Bricescreek

customer_reviews.title: Best buy for the money by far
customer_reviews.text: I had the Sonicare Diamond clean for several years before this brush and I think this is a much better deal for the money. The first week of using this brush I actually thought about throwing it out because the brush head is much larger than the slim profile on the diamond clean, and it irritated my gums. After I got used to it, though, it's been great and I don't see myself spending another $250 on a fancier toothbrush. A great feature of this is that the replacement brush heads are way cheaper than other electronic toothbrushes.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Does a fabulous job cleaning your teeth. Anybody who doesn't have one of these is missing something worthwhile. My last electric toothbrush was the cheaper Oral-B Vitality where the off switch quit after 20 years of use. I thought it was really good, but this Pro 1000 model does an even better job. My teeth feel almost like they are polished and my gums are very healthy for an old geezer. For first time users, follow the instructions and turn it on after it's in your mouth. Thank you to the reviewer who said the toothpaste sprayed all over the room -- I got a really good laugh at that.
customer_reviews.author: Creaky

customer_reviews.title: Works if you cab stand the pain.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it gives a better clean although it doesn't go between the teeth well to me. The timer works well but not the sensitivity alert. It hurt like hell for a couple of weeks now its no problem. I only continued because I was already taking pain medication for something else, otherwise it wouldn't have made sense to keep going.
customer_reviews.author: EllJay

customer_reviews.title: No Pressure Sensor
customer_reviews.text: I really like Braun (Oral B) products. I use a Braun Electric Razor and had a Pulsonic electric toothbrush. The Pulsonic was great until it stopped charging and they stopped making the brush heads. But onto the Pro 1000, unlike the Pulsonic's smooth vibration, this thing feels like it just rattles. Also, the brush head doesn't fit very tight. And finally, there is no pressure sensor. I can grab onto the thing and it just won't stop. There are other reviews that state the same thing about the pressure sensor...
customer_reviews.author: DECO

customer_reviews.title: Smiling- Little Brush Kicks Major Plaque Out of the Game!
customer_reviews.text: Solid little brush, I like the lighter weight compared to my old Oral-B ..... This brush has only one button and you push button to go thru the various settings for the teeth and gums .... Every 30 Seconds the brush does a vibration to let you know to switch quadrants and at two minutes it does and signal to let you know your done ..... At the two minute mark I go back and get spots that doc said need more attention and focus on those a bit before I brush the tongue and roof and then I go to another speed and get the gums and then I smile!
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Frosty

customer_reviews.title: Some of the toothbrushes must be faulty
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed that despite following every direction and reading through the product information my toothbrush will not charge . After being used for two minutes and it turns off despite being on the charger overnight or for more than 10 hours and I just got this product two days ago
customer_reviews.author: LolaLauren

customer_reviews.title: Strong vibrate, really cleans teeth, worried about longevity of use
customer_reviews.text: The vibrate is strong and takes getting used to. I started using this with a water pic and my teeth feel almost as clean as they do post dentist! My biggest complaint is that it seems to occasionally pause function a few times every time I use it. It's only a second or two, but it makes me feel like it's not going to last long. My husband and I share the base (we use different heads) and have been using it twice a day for a month now and it works the same as the first use, so hopefully it continues to keep up.
customer_reviews.author: KFraed

customer_reviews.title: Quit charging after 1 year and 5 months
customer_reviews.text: This toothbrush has been working great ever since I bought it. However, it just quit charging after 1 year and 5 months. I don't have another one to figure out if it's the brush or the base. Makes me concerned about the quality of the electronics. Guess I'll be ordering another one since I have no idea if any other brand is any more reliable or even brushes as well.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mosch

customer_reviews.title: Good Toothbrush, But The Built-In Timer Feature Is Annoying.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good toothbrush for the price. It holds a charge for a long time, and has a lot of power for cleaning teeth. The only reason I deducted 1 star is because of the annoying built-in timer feature. Every 30 seconds the toothbrush hesitates like it is malfunctioning, but it is just a timer to tell you to move on to the next quadrant of your teeth. Do I really need this feature? It is more annoying than useful, in my opinion. Other than the timer feature, this is a good toothbrush, and I would highly recommend it if you want to get your teeth really clean.
customer_reviews.author: Todd C Blake

customer_reviews.title: Switch now or you'll regret buying!!
customer_reviews.text: Now this packs a powerful punch, first i want to say that... I got sensitive teeth/gums. At 1-3 uses I tend to bleed, but after my gums got use to the rotation of the brush the bleeding stopped. Which is amazing and the cleaning of the product is amazing I had no issues at all with it. I haven't yet tested the bluetooth connectivity although I dont tend to, the timer is good enough. This item I also waterproof with I love, ive used it in the shower and basically dump it in a full sink of water, no issues at all. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: KevinLopez

customer_reviews.title: Horrible vibration
customer_reviews.text: I sure wish I'd read the negative reviews before wasting my money on this. The vibration is very rough and my teeth actually felt a bit loose after using it for a few days -- and I did NOT press hard on my teeth. I doubt very much using the "sensitive brush head" would make much of a difference.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush highly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast. Toothbrush is very powerful and spins pretty fast. This is a replacement to my older five year old Oral-B and this is 100 times better and I highly recommend this toothbrush. I do not know why I would need Bluetooth compatibility? The timer goes off every 30 seconds where my old one used to just go off after two minutes of rushing but I’m getting used to it
customer_reviews.author: kimberly / Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT BUY bought two of these back on May one of them stopped working. Contacted Amazon and Oral B. Right now we are in the midst of a pandemic and they want me to send the toothbrush back for “repair”? No thanks won’t be putting a dental product that has been repaired in my mouth! Terrible customer service next time I will buy the Phillips.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Handle needs minor enhancements.
customer_reviews.text: Would have rated this a 5 if ; 1. The on/off push button projected out from the handle slightly more so you can feel it with the tip of your finger. 2. The handle itself had a silicone rubber grip surface. It becomes too slippery to hold securely with wet hands when brushing. Overall, it performs its primary function of cleaning your teeth well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Beck

customer_reviews.title: Love this toothbrush!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toothbrush! My hygienist has recommended an electric toothbrush for the last two years. I don’t know why it took me so long to buy one! This simple toothbrush cleans so well, it Feels like the hygienist just cleaned my teeth! I don’t need the fancy $100 toothbrushes as this one does an excellent job! The replacement heads are better priced through Amazon as well! I’m glad I made this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: JBinOKC

customer_reviews.title: Jackhammer
customer_reviews.text: Loud and aggressive, but the small round head doesn't feel like it gets all my teeth. I dread using this brain rattling device, and have to leave the room to use it to avoid annoying my husband. Then my mouth still feels dirty because the tiny head didn't reach everywhere. And I guess there's a timer, but I haven't noticed it. And it stops when you use too much pressure, which is all the time for me. I gave it a week, but I just hate this brush.
customer_reviews.author: Beanhauer

customer_reviews.title: Works great and is very reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: My old Oral B/Braun finally bit the dust, so it was time for a new one. I didn't feel the need for Bluetooth or some of the other fancy features on the more expensive models, and the reviews on this one were excellent. It's sleek and more lightweight than my previous one. It IS a little loud, but not obnoxiously so -- pretty easy to deal with for 2 minutes. It does a great job and I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few months
customer_reviews.text: It worked for a few months, but now it doesn't turn on and doesn't charge.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: What a difference!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Oral B for years. The original one I bought back in 2007 was not cleaning as good as it once did, so I replaced it with this model. What a difference! Of course it was an upgrade compared to my old and worn out toothbrush, but Oral B has made some great improvements and I noticed a difference in the feel and look of my teeth immediately. Worth the money and I hope this one lasts just as long.
customer_reviews.author: Jdawnm66

customer_reviews.title: Lower quality old version.
customer_reviews.text: This is good price for electric toothbrush. But quality is not good. My wife used just few month, and it stopped work. Look like it damaged at turn on bottom. She told me bough a fake item., Sad. Last her item just problem with battery after 2 years used. It it acceptable but this is just few months is unacceptable. I think Oral B build item with lower quality on newer version. I think about next toothbrush should buy Oral B or not.
customer_reviews.author: Tuan Dang

customer_reviews.title: Battery going on it after two years of moderate use
customer_reviews.text: I've had this model for two years, used about 2.5 minutes a day, and the battery is going on it. Recharges in about 12 hours, but is currently only holding the charge for about four days. Was getting about a week and a half out of it before. Still, very pleased with it. Paid $40 for it, but my dental checkups have improved, making it worth the money. Price has gone up $10. Can only hope that the quality hasn't gone down.
customer_reviews.author: A. FAN

customer_reviews.title: Deep cleansing
customer_reviews.text: I am still trying to figure out the difference between vibrating because I'm brushing too hard, it is time to move the brush, or it is time to stop brushing. The charging of the toothbrush literally takes 21-24 hours to stop flashing green indicating it is full charged. The base that it connects to is a little loose so it seems like at first that it is taking forever to charge because it is not secure. My teeth feel just as clean as when I go to the dentist which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Katie912

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised, no pressure sensor
customer_reviews.text: Its a fine toothbrush but it's not as advertised. It doesn't have a pressure sensor as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed on after sales!!
customer_reviews.text: After 9 months the toothbrush stopped charging (just flashes and that's it!). There is a manufacturer's warranty for 2 years, but the manufacturer says it is Amazon's responsibility. And Amazon says it is manufacturer to take care of the issue. (Amazon has their own 3 months replace and refund policy) I am now in a situation that none of the parties take responsibility, not even help in any way! I do recommend ta inspect the terms and conditions well before any purchases! The toothbrush was very good while it was in working order, this review is mostly about after sales service. I am in Kenya, but ordered from Amazon US
customer_reviews.author: Juhani

customer_reviews.title: Did not ever charge
customer_reviews.text: This toothbrush was useless as it never charged. We returned it. Once again, I'm losing confidence in buying products that are not made in the USA. There seems to be no quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

product_meta.title: Oral-B Pro 1000 Power Rechargeable Electric Toothbrush Powered by Braun
product_meta.description: Style Name:Handle| Color:WhiteThe Oral-B PRO 1000 rechargeable electric toothbrush provides a clinically proven superior clean vs. a regular manual toothbrush. The professionally inspired design of the CrossAction brush head surrounds each tooth with bristles angled at 16 degrees, and 3D cleaning action oscillates, rotates, and pulsates to break up and remove up to 300% more plaque along the gumline vs. a regular manual toothbrush. The pressure sensor stops the pulsation movement if you brush too hard and there is 1 mode, plus an in-handle timer to help you brush for a dentist-recommended 2 minutes. Best of all, it’s brought to you by Oral-B – the #1 brand used by dentists worldwide*. Compatible with the following replacement toothbrush heads: CrossAction, 3D White, Sensitive Clean, Precision Clean, FlossAction, TriZone, Deep Sweep, ProWhite, Ortho, PowerTip, and Dual Clean. *Based on surveys of a representative worldwide sample of dentists carried out for P&G regularly.
feature_bullets: Removes up to 100% more plaque than an ordinary manual toothbrush
Senses when you brush too hard with pressure sensor
In-handle timer pulses every 30 seconds to let you know when to switch areas of the mouth

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
